faq.question: Tutte le foto danneggiate possono essere restaurate?
faq.answer: Most photos can be significantly improved, but severely damaged photos with large missing areas may have limitazioni. AI tools have expanded restoration possibilities dramatically.

faq.question: Quanto tempo richiede il restauro fotografico?
faq.answer: Le riparazioni semplici potrebbero richiedere 30 minuti a 2 ore, mentre il restauro complesso può richiedere 8-20+ ore a seconda della gravità del danno e della qualità desiderata.

faq.question: Dovrei colorizzare vecchie foto in bianco e nero?
faq.answer: Colorization is optional and depends on your goals. It can Crea/Fai photos more engaging but may lose historical authenticity. Consider keeping both versions.

faq.question: Can severely damaged photos be fully restored?
faq.answer: While some damage may be permanent, most photos can be significantly improved. Modern AI tools have expanded restoration possibilities dramatically.

faq.question: How long does professional photo repair take?
faq.answer: Simple repairs might take 1-2 hours, while extensive restoration can take 10-30+ hours depending on damage severity and desired quality.

faq.question: Should I attempt repairs myself or hire a professional?
faq.answer: Minor damage can often be repaired at home with practice. For valuable or severely damaged photos, consider professional restoration to avoid further damage.

faq.question: How long can properly conserved photos last?
faq.answer: With proper conservation, modern photographs can last 100-200+ years. Historical photos can be preserved for many more decades with appropriate care.

faq.question: What's the biggest threat to photo collections?
faq.answer: Environmental factors, especially temperature and humidity fluctuations, are typically the biggest threats. Improper storage materials and handling are also significant risks.

faq.question: Should I digitize all my photos for conservation?
faq.answer: Digitization is essential for digital preservation but doesn't replace physical conservation. Usa both approaches for comprehensive protection.
